item.title: Cronos: The New Dawn Release Date Explained‚ÄîStart Times & Release Date Confirmed
item.content:encoded:
We‚Äôre into the period of the year where big releases are coming thick and fast, with Cronos: The New Dawn included in that window, with a release date that is rapidly approaching.

A terrifying new trailer at Gamescom has ignited additional excitement ahead of release, and gamers around the world don‚Äôt have too much longer to wait until enjoying the apocalyptic adventure can begin.

If you‚Äôre looking to circle the release of Cronos: The New Dawn in your calendar, we‚Äôve got the release date details and the exact time you can start playing.

When is Cronos: The New Dawn Coming Out?

September 5 is the official release date for Cronos: The New Dawn, which will be available on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, PC, and Nintendo Switch 2.

The release date is locked in and is rapidly approaching, so there shouldn‚Äôt be any delays, and it won‚Äôt be long until your survival adventure begins.

With exploration in a brutal future, combined with travel to 1980s Poland to extract key people, the adventure through the timestream looks set to be one of the biggest games launching in this release period.

Cronos: The New Dawn Start Times

Cronos: The New Dawn will be available to play from 7am PT, with the start time being confirmed by store listings of the title.

The PlayStation Store page details exactly when you can jump into Cronos: The New Dawn, which, unlike many other titles, has a global release window. This means that everyone around the world can begin at exactly the same time, rather than the staggered launch adopted by other titles.

In the table below, we‚Äôve highlighted the precise release times for major time zones across the world to make for easier viewing. Remember, though, these have not been confirmed officially and are subject to change.

What are you looking forward to most in Cronos: The New Dawn? Will it be one of the year‚Äôs biggest releases? Let us know in the Insider Gaming forum.

For your next read, check out the release date and start times of Borderlands 4, and take a look at the Hollow Knight: Silksong review embargo date.

item.title: Rumors Of The Next Nintendo Direct Pick Up Steam
item.content:encoded:
Rumors are circling regarding the next Nintendo Direct event. According to multiple reports, Nintendo is planning to hold its next direct showcase sometime in September.

According to SwitchForce, who has been accurate with Nintendo information in the past, the next direct appears to be planned for September 12.

‚ÄúNintendo tried to phone in an emergency about the missing Switch 2 games, but they accidentally dialed 912,‚Äù they said.

It‚Äôs not just SwitchForce claiming a direct is coming. While not confirming the date, VGC did say that its own sources tell them that a mid-September Nintendo Direct is planned.

As far as what this upcoming direct would cover, that‚Äôs currently unknown. There has been speculation that it will focus on Metroid Prime 4: Beyond, especially with it recently receiving an ESRB rating. The game is also scheduled to release sometime this year, and with only four months left in the year, signs point to it being time to give fans a deeper dive into the game.

What are you hoping to see from the next Nintendo Direct? Let us know down below, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, check out what game is currently rumored to be revealed next month at Tokyo Game Show 2025. And don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter. 

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

New Skate Game Gets Official Cover Art And Early Access Release Date Teaser

The official cover art for EA‚Äôs brand-new Skate game has been revealed, and we also know when the early access release date is coming.

PlayStation Gamer Celebrates 15,000th Platinum Trophy

On social media, a PlayStation gamer has flexed unlocking his 15,000th Platinum Trophy on the PlayStation Network.

If you‚Äôre at all interested in Escape from Duckov, you‚Äôll want to read this full preview of the game‚Äôs demo.

Blood of Dawnwalker PREVIEW: Witcher-Coded But Laced with Stunning Vampirism

At Gamescom, The Blood of Dawnwalker was presented behind closed doors, offering viewers a live gameplay segment. Here‚Äôs my full preview.

item.title: Borderlands 4 Release Date Explained‚ÄîStart Times & Release Date Confirmed
item.content:encoded:
Borderlands 4‚Äôs release date is screeching into sight and is set to be one of the biggest releases in 2025, and we‚Äôve got all the details you need.

Our hands-on preview of Borderlands 4 at Gamescom raised our excitement levels for the title, which comes a whopping six years after the previous entry in the series landed, and there‚Äôs plenty to take in, with 30 billion guns featured.

If you‚Äôre looking to lock in for release, perhaps calling in sick from work for the day, we‚Äôve got all the crucial release datte and start times information you need.

When is Borderlands 4 Coming Out?

September 12 is the official release date for Borderlands 4 on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC, with Nintendo Switch 2 players having to wait a while longer until October 3.

With the Borderlands 4 release date now locked in and on the horizon, there shouldn‚Äôt be any changes to the release date. Gearbox has already made the rather unusual move of bringing the Borderlands 4 release date forward, with CEO Randy Pitchford then denying the decision had anything to do with Grand Theft Auto 6.

The release date was brought forward by ‚Äúconfidence in the game and development trajectory,‚Äù giving fans a nice early bonus. As mentioned, however, Switch 2 players have a little while longer to wait.

Borderlands 4 Start Times

Borderlands 4‚Äôs official start times are yet to be announced, but listings on the PlayStation store suggest it will be available a midnight regionally.

The UK PlayStation Store and Australian PlayStation Store both have midnight in their respective time zones, while the US PlayStation Store has a midnight release in Eastern Time stated‚Äîthough it‚Äôs unclear whether this means those in other US time zones will gain access at the same moment.

A midnight regional release would also open the door for players to gain earlier access by switching their time zone, which is much easier to do on Xbox Series X|S than it is on PlayStation. However, we won‚Äôt know for sure if this is possible until the release times are confirmed.

For easier viewing, the table below shows the release times in popular time zones. Please remember that these are subject to change; we‚Äôll be sure to keep them updated.

Is Borderlands 4 the title you‚Äôre most excited to play in 2025? Let us know your thoughts in the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Borderlands 4, check out our exclusive with Randy Pitchford admitting his nerves for tougher parts of the game, and our exclusive on Pitchford predicting over 100 million units will be sold.

item.title: Under Par Golf Architect HANDS-ON Preview: A Golf Tycoon Simulator Scoring More Birdies Than Bogeys
item.content:encoded:
Gamescom 2025 was my first hands-on with Under Par Golf Architect. A fully golf-centric tycoon simulator where you control all aspects of golf course management. As a huge golf fan, this was right up my street. It‚Äôs the perfect hybrid of golf sim and golf creation aspects, it irons out any doubts I had, you should putt this on your wishlist if you‚Äôre a golf fan, and you wood be doing yourself a disservice if you didn‚Äôt.

It feels apt that I‚Äôm writing this as the 2025 Tour Championship has concluded to wrap up the FedEx Cup. Whereas everyone was waiting for the monolithic presence of Scottie Scheffler or Rory McIlroy to take home the richest prize on the PGA Tour, it was a relative underdog in Tommy Fleetwood who comfortably prevailed.

In this scenario, EA Sports PGA Tour and 2K‚Äôs PGA Tour are Scottie and Rory, and Under Par Golf Architect is rightly Tommy.

Makes The Complexities of a Golf Complex Rather Simple

I love playing real golf, and I also can‚Äôt get enough of simulated golf, where I can immerse myself in a virtual world to pretend I‚Äôm actually good at golf and escape my real-world inadequacies and lack of talent. From the 00s Tiger Woods games to EA Sports PGA Tour and HB Studios‚Äô decade-long golf-game efforts, I‚Äôll play everything.

So it was intriguing to hear about Under Par Golf Architect. I can‚Äôt think of a dedicated golf sim game on this macro level since Sid Meier‚Äôs SimGolf in 2002. I had to see it for myself at Gamescom 2025. A private setup gave me a hands-on look and learning experience. Its premise is similar to any other ‚Äòtycoon‚Äô game: Micromanage every aspect of a golf course‚Äôs infrastructure.

You build a golf course in a plot of land, surround it with amenities to increase public satisfaction and optimize consumption of the facilities, appease your patrons, earn lots of money, and maximize customer enjoyment. You do this by tweaking the golf course to adhere to the golfer‚Äôs feedback, ensuring your workforce is on top of course maintenance, and various other factors. I visibly giggled every time I saw raccoons feeding on the course‚Äôs rubbish if left untidied for too long.

I quickly whipped up a nice little brute of a Par 3 surrounded by water, offering a horrendously undulating green. The controls were easy enough to execute my vision, and the hole design seemed funny to me. However, I quickly realized the novelty would soon be met with the hostility and incredulity of visitors‚Äîyou need to be smart and channel your inner Pete Dye or Alister Mackenzie.

I exhaled a slight ‚Äúooo‚Äù when Broken Arms Games CEO Yves Hohler showed me what was essentially an AI data model you can use to test your golf holes. It takes into account High, Mid, Low, and Scratch Handicappers and simulates how they‚Äôd all play the hole. It gives you useful insight into where they‚Äôre landing their shots‚Äîor where the less-talented of us would inexplicably be spraying and praying our golf ball around the property.

This foresight and knowledge can help you make vital changes to the course. But don‚Äôt make the course too easy, or your more experienced golfers will scoff and leave in search of a challenge. On the contrary, you need to be mindful about not making every hole narrow, hazard-filled, and with green speeds even Augusta National would consider a glass-like menace.

Under Par is a single-player tycoon sim with multiple levels and biomes arriving at launch. I‚Äôve been assured that the playing aspect was added in response to community feedback and is there if you fancy a quick knockabout. The business and simulation principles are where the game‚Äôs priorities lie. If you find PGA Tour 2K‚Äôs course creator to be a bit advanced, time-consuming, or cumbersome, I think you‚Äôll really enjoy this.

A lot of love has gone into making Under Par Golf Architect. Time will tell if it‚Äôs a bona fide major winner, but I think it‚Äôs earned its tour card and is ready to see if its vision can become par for the course.

Even non-golf fans will find plenty to love about Under Park Golf Architect. The Insider Gaming forum is the perfect place to discuss your love of golf or other tycoon games, including the Two Point series or Jurassic World Evolution.

The IG team got exclusive looks at many titles during Gamescom 2025. Check out our other previews: Valor Mortis, Super Meat Boy 3D, Hell Let Loose Vietnam, Borderlands 4, Hollow Knight: Silksong, and G‚ÄôAIM‚ÄôE.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Is Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater on Xbox Game Pass?
item.content:encoded:
Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater is bringing the neglected franchise back to life after a few years of dormancy, and we‚Äôve got all the details on whether the title is available through Game Pass.

Releasing on August 28, the full achievement list for Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater shows details of the adventure that lies ahead of Solid Snake, though confirmation that the title doesn‚Äôt feature crossplay is a blow.

If you‚Äôre on the fence about purchasing Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater and are wondering if it will be included in a Game Pass subscription, we‚Äôve got all the details.

No, Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater will not be available through an Xbox Game Pass subscription when it launches on August 28th.

Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater is not a first-party Xbox title, which would result in automatic inclusion in the service, and there has not been any announcement of it landing on the service. As such, it won‚Äôt be included.

Microsoft has already announced the second wave of August titles coming to Game Pass, covering until the end of the month, and Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater did not feature. If it was, it would‚Äôve been one of the highlights of the service, receiving a lot of attention.

Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater is unlikely to come to the Xbox Game Pass catalog in the future, and any inclusion would surely be quite far away.

Virtuos, co-developer of Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater alongside Konami, has released several titles on the Game Pass service in the past, though the final decision with this title will more than likely fall upon Konami.

Konami‚Äôs publishing on Xbox is much more limited, and their titles barely ever feature in the Game Pass catalog, so it seems unlikely that Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater will make an appearance in the library anytime soon. However, stranger things have happened.

If you do want to play Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater on Xbox, the best approach is to purchase the game for launch.

Are you planning on picking up Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater? Let us know in the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater, check out details of the review embargo, and take a look at the differences between the new title and the original.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: New Skate Game Gets Official Cover Art And Early Access Release Date Teaser
item.content:encoded:
EA‚Äôs long-awaited Skate sequel is in the works. We know it‚Äôs progressing well, and confirmation of this comes courtesy of the game‚Äôs X account, which has not only showcased its awesome cover art but also gone one step further and teased us with a tricky early access release date notice.

15 years‚Äîyes, FIFTEEN‚Äîyears have come and gone since Skate 3. EA released one of the most popular skating games in history. Then capitalized on this by‚Ä¶doing nothing. Skate fans have had to wait a long time for a new game, and even then, development on the new Skate title has taken several years. However, the updates are coming thick and fast, including news on its early access release date.

Skate Early Access Release Date Coming Very Soon

The official EA Skate X page has shown off the stunning new Skate art. The vibrant and almost pastel-like cover is a clean and smooth image, and is all the game cover needed to be. It‚Äôs a win-win in my books.

But even more eye-catching is the news of Skate‚Äôs early access release date. While the X account hasn‚Äôt let the info slip just yet, we know it‚Äôs arriving imminently: August 26, to be exact.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre stoked to reveal the official skate. cover art! Come back on Tuesday 8/26‚Ä¶we‚Äôre giving you the Early Access release date. See ya then,‚Äù said a post on Skate‚Äôs social media page.

We‚Äôre stoked to reveal the official skate. cover art! Come back on Tuesday 8/26‚Ä¶we‚Äôre giving you the Early Access release date. See ya then. üõπ

You don‚Äôt have to wait much longer to find out when you get to finally tinker with your trucks, get your pads on, and Skate like hell. Let us know through the Insider Gaming forum if you‚Äôre excited for a new era of skating games riding alongside each other.

Check out the news that EA‚Äôs Skate does not have an Offline Mode and the latest on Skate‚Äôs microtransactions for more content.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.



https://insider-gaming.com/new-skate-game-gets-official-cover-art-and-early-access-release-date-teaser/

item.title: When is The Hollow Knight: Silksong Review Embargo Date?
item.content:encoded:
Hollow Knight: Silksong is nearly upon us, and all eyes are cast towards the review scores, and we‚Äôve got the details on when the review embargo lifts.

Hollow Knight: Silksong releases September 4, and is included with an Xbox Game Pass subscription, with anticipation for the title reaching fever-pitch levels following the long-awaited release date announcement.

Whether you‚Äôre on the fence about playing or want to see how hyped everyone is for the launch of Hollow Knight: Silksong, here are all the review embargo details.

Hollow Knight: Silksong Review Embargo Date, Explained

The Hollow Knight: Silksong review embargo is expected to be September 4, when the game releases, with Team Cherry reportedly not distributing early codes.

Bloomberg‚Äôs Jason Schreier stated that Team Cherry is not planning on sending out early codes for Hollow Knight: Silksong, so players should not expect to see any reviews until after the September 4 launch.

This is because the developers ‚Äúfelt like it‚Äôd be unfair for critics to be playing before Kickstarter backers and other players,‚Äù though they are also a small team and it would take a lot of time to get codes and distribute them, particularly given the amount of work that lies ahead before the release.

Therefore, players shouldn‚Äôt expect to see any reviews published until the September 4 release, and, even then, the first drop may not be a full reflection of the game and may be an in-progress review as journalists, like everyone else, push through to complete the game.

What Hollow Knight: Silksong Scores Can we Expect?

Hype for Hollow Knight: Silksong has been in overdrive for a while, and, given the success of the first game, expect to see the sequel rate very highly.

Our hands-on preview at Gamescom resulted in a verdict that the title is well worth the wait, with no suggestion that Hollow Knight: Silksong will score poorly. In fact, it could end up being one of the most successful launches of the year, score-wise.

Metacritic for the original Hollow Knight is impressively high, with an average of 90 from critic reviews, while the user score, based on 4,321 reviews, puts the game at 9.1.

Though the first game set a very high bar, we expect Silksong to follow suit with some equally impressive numbers to establish itself as one of the must-play titles of the year.

How highly rated are you expecting Hollow Knight: Silksong to be? Let us know in the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Hollow Knight: Silksong, read why the game took so long to release, and take a look at whether a demo is available to download.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.
